edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.database

Class DAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.database.DAO

  • public class DAO
extends java.lang.Object
    Data Access Object (DAO) The DAO is a singleton (the constructor is private). This design uses only one DAO for accessing all tables in the SQLite database.

        public void addBackgroundObject(java.lang.String imagePath)
        Adds a background image to the database.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - A String representing the path to the the image

        public java.util.List<LevelBackgroundObject> getBackgroundObjects()

      • addAstroid

        public void addAstroid(java.lang.String type,
              java.lang.String image,
              int width,
              int height)
        Adds an asteroid type to the database.
        Parameters:
        type - Usually the name of the asteroid. Example: "octeroid"
        image - The path to the asteroid image
        width - The image width (pixels)
        height - The image height (pixels)

      • addLevel

        public void addLevel(int number,
            java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String hint,
            int width,
            int height,
            java.lang.String music)
        Adds a level to the database.
        Parameters:
        number - The level number (this will serve as the primary key)
        title - The name (or title) of the level
        hint - A hint corresponding to the level. Example: "Destroy a regular asteroid"
        width - The image width (pixels)
        height - The image height (pixels)
        music - The path to the background music file for the level

      • getLevels

        public java.util.List<LevelType> getLevels()
        Gets a list of all levels in the database.
        Returns:
        A list of LevelType objects

      • addLevelAsteroid

        public void addLevelAsteroid(int number,
                    int astroidId,
                    int levelId)
        Maps an asteroid type to a particular level in the database.
        Parameters:
        number - The number of asteroids with ID asteroidId on
        astroidId - The ID number of the asteroid. FK: asteroid(id)
        levelId - The level number that the asteroid appears on. FK: levels(id)

      • addLevelBackgroundObject

        public void addLevelBackgroundObject(java.lang.String position,
                            int objectId,
                            int scale,
                            int level_id)
        Maps a background object to a particular level in the database.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the object. Example: "150, 75"
        objectId - The ID of the background object. FK: background_objects(id)
        scale - The scale of the background object. Example: 2.0
        level_id - The level number the object appears on. FK: levels(id)

      • addCannon

        public void addCannon(java.lang.String attachPoint,
             java.lang.String emitPoint,
             java.lang.String image,
             int width,
             int height,
             java.lang.String attackImage,
             int attackWidth,
             int attackHeight,
             java.lang.String attackSound,
             int damage)
        Adds a cannon to the database.
        Parameters:
        attachPoint - The attachment point to the rest of the ship. Example: "150, 75"
        emitPoint - The point at which the lasers are emitted. Example: "200, 75"
        image - The path to the cannon image
        width - The image width (pixels)
        height - The image height (pixels)
        attackImage - The path to the firing cannon image
        attackWidth - The width of the firing cannon image
        attackHeight - The height of the firing cannon image
        attackSound - The path to the sound of the cannon firing
        damage - The damage power of the cannon

      • getCannons

        public java.util.List<Cannon> getCannons()
        Gets a list of all cannons in the database.
        Returns:
        A list of Cannon objects

      • addEngine

        public void addEngine(int baseSpeed,
             int baseTurnRate,
             java.lang.String attachPoint,
             java.lang.String image,
             int width,
             int height)
        Adds an engine to the database.
        Parameters:
        baseSpeed - The default speed of the engine
        baseTurnRate - The turn rate of engine
        attachPoint - The attachment point to the rest of the ship. Example: "150, 75"
        image - The path to the engine image
        width - The width of the engine image (pixels)
        height - The height of the engine image (pixels)

      • getEngines

        public java.util.List<Engine> getEngines()
        Returns a list of all engines in the database.
        Returns:
        A list of Engine objects

               java.lang.String attachPoint,
               int width,
               int height)
        Adds a left wing (aka "extraPart" to the database.
        Parameters:
        image - The path to the wing image
        attachPoint - The attchment point to the rest of the ship. Example: "150, 75"
        width - The wing image width
        height - The wing image height

      • addMainBody

        public void addMainBody(java.lang.String cannonAttach,
               java.lang.String engineAttach,
               java.lang.String leftWingAttach,
               java.lang.String image,
               int width,
               int height)
        Adds a mainBody to the database.
        Parameters:
        cannonAttach - The attachment point of the cannon. Example: "150, 75"
        engineAttach - The attachment point of the engine. Example: "150, 75"
        leftWingAttach - The attachment point of the left wing. Example: "150, 75"
        image - The path to the main body image
        width - The main body image width (pixels)
        height - The main body image height (pixels)
